ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you want a great WR course that covers the jungle & clash between the civilization and the savage take this course. You will leave with a greater appreciation for the authors and for the themes that are covered in this class.
Wonderful class and a good cursory literature class for those who haven't taken one yet.
Yes--I would absolutely recommend SPAN 393 to another student who is interested in learning about this genre of books (and films).
An excellent literature course, however there is a lot of reading.
Laid back course, interesting readings. Worth it.

This class was great! A wonderful core seminar for literature majors or just a great class for anyone to take. My one warning is that there was not a lot of opportunity for student participation when discussing the texts even though this was supposed to be a seminar.

I would definitely recommend this class! Be prepared for a few uncomfortable comments from the professor (he has an antiquated machisto perspective), but this was an easy WR credit with really great literature to read. I hadn't considered "jungle books" as a sub-genre, but I loved all the novels I read for this class and I learned what to look for when I read.
